channel.title: Military Roll Call
channel.description:
Who on here is in the military or planning to join the militia?
I've been thinking about joining the Air Force so I can essentially get experience for a job and obtain the GI-Bill so it can pay for my school.
All discussion/advice is appreciated.

item.title: Military Roll Call
item.dc:creator: @Michael_P1 Michael P
item.description:
@Michael_P1 wrote:

Joining the Marines after high school. Would like to go into the infantry as a rifleman. One of my best friends is going to Parris Island this summer, I’m kinda jelly…

Read full topic

item.title: Military Roll Call
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

thiefmn6092:

previously a 11B, now a 31B in the US Army

My buddy was a 31B in the National Guard but he’s out now. I don’t think he liked it that much lol

Read full topic

item.title: Military Roll Call
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:16, topic:539622”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=658463.msg4404536#msg4404536 date=1391498318]

I’m in the Air Force and it was easily the best decision I’ve ever made. I have an I.T. job that I love and the pay isn’t bad considering I have no college experience. Also… Free college!

Message me if you want to know anything specific about the USAF.
[/quote]Do you know somebody named Chris Clinger? Unlikely but I thought I’d ask
Clear out your PM box

It’s a small Air Force; but not that small

I should have unlimited message space… I guess not :/[/quote]Clear your inbox… Your old messages aren’t that important

Read full topic

item.title: Military Roll Call
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:19, topic:539622”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=658463.msg4404548#msg4404548 date=1391504676]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=658463.msg4404417#msg4404417 date=1391467122]

[quote author=Ruby link=topic=658463.msg4404365#msg4404365 date=1391457748]

That’s pretty stupid imho, letting emotional hormonal potential train-wrecks join. You need parental consent to join at 17 here, 18 to join without.

They can only take part in basic training usually at ITC Catterick and then after their passing out parade they move to their permanent barracks and can’t be stationed overseas until they are 18 at the earliest, by which time they’re a lance corporal and half way to being a corporal. If you’re set on a military career then I don’t see why you wouldn’t want to join the military at that age.
[/quote]That’s what I mean. I don’t think anyone should be ‘set’ on such a concrete path at that age.
[/quote]so it’s ok at 17 but not 16?
[/quote]With parental (ie - people not still in puberty) consent it makes a world of difference.[/quote]

Ruby:

16 in the UK with parental consent.

Read full topic

That’s pretty stupid imho, letting emotional hormonal potential train-wrecks join. You need parental consent to join at 17 here, 18 to join without.

They can only take part in basic training usually at ITC Catterick and then after their passing out parade they move to their permanent barracks and can’t be stationed overseas until they are 18 at the earliest, by which time they’re a lance corporal and half way to being a corporal. If you’re set on a military career then I don’t see why you wouldn’t want to join the military at that age.
[/quote]That’s what I mean. I don’t think anyone should be ‘set’ on such a concrete path at that age.
[/quote]so it’s ok at 17 but not 16?[/quote]With parental (ie - people not still in puberty) consent it makes a world of difference.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Serve 4 years and get out with that GI Bill… I collected it because it was given to me (without the need to serve) but basically paid for a full year of school and put $1500 a month into my pocket WORTH

Read full topic

item.title: Military Roll Call
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Honestly, I’m interested in joining the military because it would give me great discipline on life. I’m a hard procrastinator and am very unmotivated to find anything interesting to do for a career. So that’s why I’m learning military.

Read full topic

item.title: Military Roll Call
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

It’s not necessarily being set on a path. One of the purposes of the militia is to feel the army out, to see if you’re army material. That’s why you’re eligible to join and leave at any given time during basic or service, no questions asked. It’s also smart if you want to have a career in the army though as it works toward your pension plan.

Read full topic

[/quote]
They can only take part in basic training usually at ITC Catterick and then after their passing out parade they move to their permanent barracks and can’t be stationed overseas until they are 18 at the earliest, by which time they’re a lance corporal and half way to being a corporal. If you’re set on a military career then I don’t see why you wouldn’t want to join the military at that age.[/quote]That’s what I mean. I don’t think anyone should be ‘set’ on such a concrete path at that age.

item.title: Military Roll Call
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:6, topic:539622”]That’s pretty stupid imho, letting emotional hormonal potential train-wrecks join. You need parental consent to join at 17 here, 18 to join without.[/quote]Well in the UK you can move out at 16. Most people finish high school when they’re 16. It wouldn’t seem fair to make people wait an entire year if they wanted to start a military career.

Read full topic

item.title: Military Roll Call
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:4, topic:539622”][quote author=Scape-JAVA link=topic=658463.msg4404353#msg4404353 date=1391454905]
I’m with the highlanders infantry regiment. I think it’s pretty worth it, they subsidize your education here but I’m not so certain about the US. I would definitely recommend going into it though, great experience and the comradery is unforgettable. You make friends you’ll have for the rest of your life.
[/quote]You can do that at 16 there?[/quote]

yeppers.

Read full topic

item.title: Military Roll Call

That’s pretty stupid imho, letting emotional hormonal potential train-wrecks join. You need parental consent to join at 17 here, 18 to join without.

They can only take part in basic training usually at ITC Catterick and then after their passing out parade they move to their permanent barracks and can’t be stationed overseas until they are 18 at the earliest, by which time they’re a lance corporal and half way to being a corporal. If you’re set on a military career then I don’t see why you wouldn’t want to join the military at that age.
